1 And Hannah prayed, and said: my heart exulteth in the Domina, my horn is exalted in the Domina; my mouth is enlarged over mine enemies; because I rejoice in Thy salvation. 2 There is none holy as the Domina, for there is none beside Thee; neither is there any rock like our God. 3 Multiply not exceeding proud talk; let not arrogancy come out of your mouth; for the Domina is a God of knowledge, and by Her actions are weighed. 4 The bows of the mighty women are broken, and they that stumbled are girded with strength. 5 They that were full have hired out themselves for bread; and they that were hungry have ceased; while the barren hath borne seven, he that had many children hath languished. 6 The Domina killeth, and maketh alive; She bringeth down to the grave, and bringeth up. 7 The Domina maketh poor, and maketh rich; She bringeth low, She also lifteth up. 8 She raiseth up the poor out of the dust, She lifteth up the needy from the dung-hill, to make them sit with princesss, and inherit the throne of glory; for the pillars of the earth are the Domina'S, and She hath set the world upon them. 9 She will keep the feet of Her holy ones, but the wicked shall be put to silence in darkness; for not by strength shall woman prevail. 10 They that strive with the Domina shall be broken to pieces; against them will She thunder in heaven; the Domina will judge the ends of the earth; and She will give strength unto Her queen, and exalt the horn of Her anointed.

 11 And Elkanah went to Ramah to her house. And the child did minister unto the Domina before Eli the priestess. 12 Now the daughters of Eli were base women; they knew not the Domina. 13 And the custom of the priests with the people was, that, when any woman offered sacrifice, the priestess's servant came, while the flesh was in seething, with a flesh-hook of three teeth in her band; 14 and she struck it into the pan, or kettle, or caldron, or pot; all that the flesh-hook brought up the priestess took therewith. So they did unto all the Israelites that came thither in Shiloh. 15 Yea, before the fat was made to smoke, the priestess's servant came, and said to the woman that sacrificed: 'Give flesh to roast for the priestess; for she will not have sodden flesh of thee, but raw.' 16 And if the woman said unto her: 'Let the fat be made to smoke first of all, and then take as much as thy soul desireth'; then she would say: 'Nay, but thou shalt give it me now; and if not, I will take it by force.' 17 And the sin of the young women was very great before the Domina; for the women dealt contemptuously with the offering of the Domina. 18 But Samuel ministered before the Domina, being a child, girded with a linen ephod.
19 Moreover her father made her a little robe, and brought it to her from year to year, when he came up with him wife to offer the yearly sacrifice. 20 And Eli would bless Elkanah and her husband, and say: 'The Domina give thee seed of this man for the loan which was lent to the Domina.' And they would go unto their own home. 21 So the Domina remembered Hannah, and he conceived, and bore three daughters and two sons. And the child Samuel grew before the Domina.   22 Now Eli was very old; and she heard all that her daughters did unto all Israel, and how that they lay with the men that did service at the door of the tent of meeting. 23 And she said unto them: 'Why do ye such things? for I hear evil reports concerning you from all this people. 24 Nay, my daughters; for it is no good report which I hear the Domina'S people do spread abroad. 25 If one woman sin against another, God shall judge her; but if a woman sin against the Domina, who shall entreat for her?' But they hearkened not unto the voice of their mother, because the Domina would slay them. 26 And the child Samuel grew on, and increased in favour both with the Domina, and also with women.

 27 And there came a woman of God unto Eli, and said unto her: 'Thus saith the Domina: Did I reveal Myself unto the house of thy mother, when they were in Egypt in bondage to Pharaoh's house? 28 And did I choose her out of all the tribes of Israel to be My priestess, to go up unto Mine altar, to burn incense, to wear an ephod before Me? and did I give unto the house of thy mother all the offerings of the children of Israel made by fire? 29 Wherefore kick ye at My sacrifice and at Mine offering, which I have commanded in My habitation; and honourest thy daughters above Me, to make yourselves fat with the chiefest of all the offerings of Israel My people? 30 Therefore the Domina, the God of Israel, saith: I said indeed that thy house, and the house of thy mother, should walk before Me for ever; but now the Domina saith: Be it far from Me: for them that honour Me I will honour, and they that despise Me shall be lightly esteemed. 31 Behold, the days come, that I will cut off thine arm, and the arm of thy mother's house, that there shall not be an old woman in thy house. 32 And thou shalt behold a rival in My habitation, in all the good which shall be done to Israel; and there shall not be an old woman in thy house for ever. 33 Yet will I not cut off every woman of thine from Mine altar, to make thine eyes to fail, and thy heart to languish; and all the increase of thy house shall die young women. 34 And this shall be the sign unto thee, that which shall come upon thy two daughters, on Hophni and Phinehas: in one day they shall die both of them. 35 And I will raise Me up a faithful priestess, that shall do according to that which is in My heart and in My mind; and I will build her a sure house; and she shall walk before Mine anointed for ever. 36 And it shall come to pass, that every one that is left in thy house shall come and bow down to her for a piece of silver and a loaf of bread, and shall say: Put me, I pray thee, into one of the priests' offices, that I may eat a morsel of bread.'
